716556f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Broadway (North).
716556f-a.text:
Battery Park: A northward view to Broadway, from the wators edge. To the left is the Washington Building. On the right is the tower atop the Produce Exchange. Note the absence of the U. S. Custom House.
About 1900
Thomas W. Eennedy, photo
Thru Beecher Ogden
Museum Photographers Assn.

716541f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716541f-a.text:
Battery Park: The monument erected by the city in 1818 to mark the S.W. bastion of Fort George. It disapoeared in some mysterious manner, probably during the filling in of the Battery in 1851. It was unearthed during the excavations for the subway, and was replaced near the sidewalk in the gronds of the park in 1907. T.2- 2--SS SE. 3E ~~y..7f. SeS2S  EC. ~--4, AF9S2, ~. V1
Sept. 11, 1904.
Gift of W. Jerone Daly
Sec't., Board of Transportation City of New York
William 5. Parsons Collection

716552f.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - [Shore and skyline.]
716552f.text:
March 14,1914 From the Review of Reviews. Photo by American Press Assn.
Nc.1. PRiA
716552f.folder: Battery Park & [Shore and skyline.], Manhattan, NY

716557f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street (Northeast).
716557f-a.text:
Battery Park: A northeastward view towards State Street (elevated line thereon) and showing under construction, at the S.E. corner of that
and Bridge Street, the 12-story Battery Park Building.
About 1915.
EEE3A13:.
716557f-a.folder: Battery Park & State Street (Northeast)., Manhattan, NY

710050f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
710050f-a.text:
Battery Park: A northward view from the Sea Wall showing citizens enjoyinn a respite from the summmer heat. Undergoing reconstruction is the Washington Bldg. (No. 1 Broadway). Beyond same is the Woolworth Bldg. silhouette with the Equitable roof and the Bankers Trust pyramid opposite. The latter is overshadowing the Standard Oil Buildings and the .S. Custom House.
About 1915
Ewinm Galloway

716559f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park (North).
716559f-b.text:
Battery Park: A set of three views of the high wind and tide breaking at this point. No. 1 is northward across same to show buildings on Battery Place; No. 2 being at the rear of the Aduarium, and No. 3, the Basin to
the west of the latter point.
October 25, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.

to the Ell4s Island Ferry and United States Barge Office.
October 25, 1926.

716554f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street.
716554f-b.text:
(1)
Battery Park: A northwestward view across a corner of same, from State Street (trolley car thereon), and alightly southward of Pearl Street. Appearing acroas the elevated spur are the two. units of the Whitehall Building; the Downtown Athletic Club; and framework of No. 21 West Street.
June 20, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a vantage point slightly westward.
June 20, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

716561f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street (Northeast).
716561f-a.text:
Battery Park: A northeastward view towards State Street from the Sea Wall. Buildings shown lining this confine of the Park are: the United States Custom House, the Battery Park Building (No. 21-24 State Street) and the Chesebrough Building (No. 15-19 State Street). This set consists
of 2 views.
October 7, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
716561f-a.folder: Battery Park & State Street (Northeast)., Manhattan, NY

put to sea.
September 27, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

716542f-b.text:
Battery Park: A set of 3 views in a northeastward direction towards State Street and showing there upon the low Custom House Building overshadowed by the towering Standard Oil, 60 Wall Street and the Farmers
Loan and Trust.Company Buildings.
Ju1y 11, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

716510f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - The Firehouse.
716510f-a.text:
Battery Park: The firehouse at
the Battery that provides a base for the several fireboats serving the City. No records of its construction can be found and it probably dates from the same time as the Park, 1886. In the background of same appears the rear of the circular aquarium. This photo was reproduced on page 30 in the published volume "Changing New York."
May 12, 1936
Berenice Abbott, photo
Federal Art Project
716510f-a.folder: Battery Park & The Firehouse., Manhattan, NY

716543f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - [View from confluence of North (Hudson) and East Rivers.]
716543f-a.text:
(1)
Battery Park; A northward view of same as seen from the confluence of the North (Hudson) and East Rivers. Surrounding and over-shadowing this garden area are office structures of downtown Manhattan's
business and financial district.
July 1, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, viewing eastward, showing the Fireboat Station and the
Aquarium.
July 19, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
716543f-a.folder: Battery Park & [View from confluence of North (Hudson) and East Rivers.], Manhattan, NY

716555f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Broadway (North).
716555f-a.text:
N:attery Park: A set of three views of same in a westward direction from the waters edge. No. 1 shows the new ticket booth partially obstructing a view of the Aquarium. Prominent structure appearing is the Whitehall Building. No. 2 shows a comfort station. No. 3 is at the sea wall and showing a northward view up Broadway.
July 19, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

716538f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - State Street [Northward from landing platform.]
716538f-a.text:
(1 A 2)
Battery Park: A view northward from the Landing Platform and showing a troop of Boy Scouts en route from a Washington Jamboree. Note the Aquarium on the left, silhouetted against the Washington Building. View No. 2 is similar and includes a concessionaire booth.
July 10, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The ticket booth as viewed in an eastward direction towards State
Street.
July 10, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

716550f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - [Shore and skyline.]
716550f-a.text:
8attery Park, its embarkadero and excursion steamers nestling at the tip of Manhattan and washed by the confluence of the Hudson and East Rivers. Thru the center is the Broadway canyon ard its towerinr office buildings. Pyramiding to the right are the Wall Street structures, dominated by the lofty Bank of Manhattan and
the City Bank-Farmers Trust Co. Buildings.
1938-9
Alexander Alland
716550f-a.folder: Battery Park & [Shore and skyline.], Manhattan, NY

716553f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716553f-a.text:
Battery Park The Bulletin Board that was presented to the City by John D. Reilly, the head of the Todd Ship Yards. This is a constant source of interest to business men, employees, visitore and others, emphasising the inportance of New York as a great sea port. In the background are the various structures forming the well known skyline. Trominent among these are the Irving Trust, the Standard Oil, and the Bank of
Manhattan buildings.
The New York Herald-Tribune of November 12, 1939, Section VII
(gravure) carried a similar view.
July 28, 1939
P. L. Sperr

716576f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park - Washington Street
716576f-a.text:
Battery Place, north side, east from Washington Street, showing mainly the street frontage extending to Greenwich Street where the old bth E. 9th Avenue "El" station appears. The latter is shortly to be demolished.
April 6, 1940
No's. 1-2

716563f-a.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716563f-a.text:
Battery Park: A northward view to Broadway from the waters edge. This thoroughfare is in the center where the spire of Tfinity Whurch appears. To the left and right of same, respectively are, the Washington Building and the Produce Exchange. Note the uniform residences on the later Custom
House site.
1890e
J.S. Johnston
Thru fhe New York Historical Society

716562f-c.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716562f-c.text:
Battery Park: A northwestward view towards Battery Place and West Street and showing upon the latter the two units of the Whitehall Building; the Downtown Athletic Club, and the United Fruit Building. This is a set of 3 views; No. 3 being photographed from the South Ferry Terminal of the Elevated Lines. Buildings appearing on the right of
the latter are on State Street.
July 23, 1932.
View 2:-0ctober 3, 1933.
View 3:-May 25, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

716566f-b.title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
716566f-b.text:
(1)
Battery Park: A view northeastward across the northern edge of same, towards the foot of Broadway and showing upon the latter the Standard Oil Tower under construction. Note the changed appearance of the Washington
Building, which appears in the center.
Summer 1923.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date.
June 1925.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A more inclusive view.
September 31, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.
